name: terminable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of an agreement, relationship, etc.) able to be ended : This agreement is terminable by either party on 60 days' notice. Employment is "at will" and terminable at any time, with or without cause.
More examplesFewer examplesYour employment here is contingent on your adhering to the rules and is terminable if those rules are violated. The tenancy is terminable if rent is not collected or if the property is not kept in good condition by the tenant. The contract is terminable if the terms are breached by either party.
